items.message:
There is no longer a threat of flooding, though standing water and debris may still remain.
Weather conditions are expected to improve throughout the morning and no further flooding is expected.
There may still be some areas where flood water is present until it can naturally drain away.
Stay away from floodwater - it contains hidden dangers such as open manhole covers, sewage and chemicals.

High river levels throughout the morning may lead to flooding.
Flooding is forecast to affect locations near the River Wyre, with low lying land and roads expected to be most affected, particularly around River Wyre, River Cocker, Pilling Water and other watercourses from Catterall to Fleetwood, including St Michaels and Great Eccleston and Preesall.
Weather conditions are expected to improve throughout the afternoon and no further flooding is expected.
Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water.
Please do not drive through floodwater as bow waves may affect adjacent properties.
This message will be updated by 17:30 PM on 10/06/2025, or as the situation changes.

High river levels throughout the morning may lead to flooding. Flooding is possible when river levels are at their highest from 5:00 AM on 10/06/2025.
Flooding is forecast to affect locations near the River Ribble, River Hodder, with low lying land and roads expected to be most affected, particularly around Rivers Ribble, Hodder and other watercourses, from Settle to Samlesbury including Clitheroe, Gisburn, Sawley, Waddington and Ribchester.
Weather conditions are expected to improve tomorrow afternoon and no further flooding is expected.
Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water.
Monitor local water levels and weather conditions.
Please do not drive through floodwater as bow waves may affect adjacent properties.
This message will be updated by 17:30 PM on 10/06/2025, or as the situation changes.
